name: SpringHill Suites Fairbanks

reviews.title: Great room at a good price
reviews.text: We had been traveling through Alaska for several days. It was summer solistice and nearly all hotels were sold out in Fairbanks. Spring Hill found us a room two days befoe we arrived. The room was located on the fourth floor. It was a huge room with two queen beds, (nearly 500 square feet) a large sitting area and a great view of the City and waterfront. The room was immacuately clean.

reviews.title: Very comfortable
reviews.text: The front desk staff were helpful and generally cheerful despite the fact that every room in the hotel was sold out. The pool area was clean and well kept up. One small problem is that the hotel has limited parking on-site and you may have to park a block away in a not well lighted area.
The buffet breakfast in the morning was well above average and included sausages and eggs as well as many other offerings.
reviews.title: 2 Weeks in Fairbanks is not enough !!
Terrific service
reviews.text: We paid $ 155 for the room which was a steal compared to what we had paid in Denali Park and in Anchorage. We would recommend this hotel for its location, by Pioneer Square, and its helpful staff. (June 25, 2005)

reviews.title: Very good restaurant
reviews.text: An excellent hotel - great for businessmen, families and couples. The room was very comfortable and nicely decorated. A kitchenette consisting of a fridge, microwave and coffee maker (paper plates and plastic cutlery were provided each day) were all very useful.

reviews.title: Nice Stay
reviews.text: Stayed overnight in March 2004 on business. First time at this hotel as it is usually sold out. I know why. Great location and Lavalle's is best restaurant in Fairbanks - there aren't many good ones!

reviews.title: Great place to stay
reviews.text: Typical Spring Hill Suites, but for Fairbanks that's a 4 star hotel.

reviews.title: recommended
reviews.text: Will stay again although the Westmark is opening a new tower soon.

reviews.title: Very nice
reviews.text: Hotel room was VERY clean and quiet. We stayed on the sixth floor. The stay was very helpful. Don't park on the street any longer then the signs allow for or you might get a parking ticket like I did. Centrally located which was nice. We stayed six nights in Mid March. Ft Wainwright is close by and you can get a pass to get on base and go sleding with the kids which was nice. Get away from town at night to see the northern lights on a clear night. Probably no more then 20 min's from the airport. Never went in the pool but it looked nice, and warm! Room had two TV's, desk,Frig.,Microwave,couch, chairs,iron w/board,two sinks & internet access.

reviews.title: Gracious Staff, Great Breakfasts
reviews.text: We stayed two separate times around Christmas 2003 and enjoyed both times. Very helpful staff, pool and jacuzzi were clean (& devoid of other guests), and bar/restaurant has a good selection of local beer.

description: Come stay in downtown Fairbanks next to the Chena River. Featuring separate areas for sleeping, eating and working, SpringHill Suites provides guests with a microwave, mini-fridge, desk and pull-out sofa bed. Enjoy complimentary continental breakfast buffet and airport shuttle, as well as pool, whirlpool, exercise room and wireless.
